intro: Oreocharis rosthornii, commonly known as the rosthorn's oreocharis, is a rare flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, preferring cool and moist environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers feature a unique combination of white and purple hues. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered an endangered species.
